title: How to Become a Better Sniper in Battlefield 3

steps.headline: Always use the same Sniper!
steps.description: This will make you get used to the bullet drop and you will always know where to aim at certain distances.

steps.headline: Always use the same scope!
steps.description: Each Scope is different, they all have different distance positions and crosshair, get used to one and your a step closer.

steps.headline: Try to hold your breath in game to get a steadier aim and a more calm room to really focus on your shot!
If you are using a and Bolt action Sniper at close range, then you miss a shot at the enemy up close, Always switch to your knife or secondary weapon.
Use the your Equipment!
steps.description: If you are on a crane or building, use a Spawn Beacon so the rest of your squad can help you out. Or use a motion sensor so you know if somebody is behind you

steps.headline: Stay with a member of your Squad!
steps.description: Your squad can help you very much in these ways Medic: Revives you so you don't use up your Beacon. Assault: If you run out of ammo, just hit the select button and your Assault member will be there. Engineer: Just in case you break down in a quick getaway

steps.headline: Stay in prone as much as you can!
steps.description: If you stay in prone your enemy will have a little more difficulty getting a good shot and if you use a bipod, it will be better for aiming.

steps.headline: Aim for the chest and head because they take more damage depending on where you hit them
Fire more than 1 shot at a target!
steps.description: If you get a nice shot on your enemy but no kill, remember to double click the mouse/right trigger/ Right 1

steps.headline: Get a good vantage point because it will be easier to see your enemies without your enemies finding you
